intro: Nothopanax delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay's nothopanax, is a flowering plant native to the Yunnan province in China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within mountainous regions. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a woody stem structure. Nothopanax delavayi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
